questions.text: A JMFC can Impose a fine up to
questions.solution:
• A JMSC can pass an imprisonment up to 1 year and can impose a fine up to Rs. 10,000.
  • A JMFC can pass an imprisonment up to 3 year and can impose a fine up to Rs. 50,000.
  • A CJM can pass an imprisonment up to 7 years and can impose unlimited fine.
  • All three can impose to do community service also.

questions.text: According to which section of BNS, a child above 7 years and below 12 years is may/may not be liable for his criminal conduct?
questions.solution:
• 20 BNS → A child < 7 years: Not liable for criminal act.
  • 21 BNS → A child between 7 and 12 years: May/may not be liable for criminal act (Depending on mental maturity).
  • 22 BNS → Act of a person of unsound mind (Derived from McNaughten's rule).
  • 23 BNS → Involuntary intoxication: Not liable for criminal act.
  • Sec. 24 BNS → Voluntary intoxication: Liable for criminal act

questions.text: Perjury is punishable under which section of BNS?
questions.solution:
• 227 BNS → Giving false evidence (Perjury) - Definition
  • 228 BNS → Fabricating false evidence - Definition
  • 229 BNS → Punishment for Sec. 227 & 228 BNS (Up to 7 years of imprisonment)
  • Sec. 234 BNS → Issuing or signing false certificate (Punishment is same as for giving false evidence)

questions.text: In case of a child below the age of 12 years, the parents/guardian can give consent as per BNS section
questions.solution:
• Sec. 25 BNS → A person > 18 years, can give consent for surgical procedure.
  • Sec. 27 BNS → In case of a child < 12 years/unsoundness of mind → Parent/guardian can give consent.
  • Sec. 28 BNS → Defines invalid consent - Consent is invalid when given:
  1. Under fear of injury or
  2. Under a misconception of fact or
  3. By a person who, from unsoundness of mind, or intoxication, is unable to understand the nature and consequence of that to which he gives his consent, or
  4. By a child < 12 years)
  • Sec. 30 BNS → Act done in good faith for benefit of a person without consent. (A doctor can perform surgery in emergency, where it is impossible for that person to signify consent)

questions.text: During surgery, if a doctor feels to remove/operate more than what he anticipated before surgery, then he is covered under which doctrine?
questions.solution:
• Doctrine of Anticipation: Aka, 'substituted judgment' or 'best interest standard' - In case of incapacitated/incompetent patients based on what the patient would have chosen if they could make their own decisions. Immunity to the doctor by Sec. 30 of BNS
  • Extended doctrine of implied consent: Applied in circumstances where the factors surrounding are deemed reasonable & appropriate. E.g., Doctor feels to remove/operate more than what he anticipated before surgery.
  • Doctrine of extended consent (Extension doctrine): Applied in circumstances when the patient originally consented for a specific procedure, but at the time of performance of such procedure, further issues are encountered that are best resolved at the current time. If it is infeasible at that time to further consent the patient/party, then the original consent would be extended to cover the unexpected further care.
  • Res ipsa loquitur: The things speak for itself.
  • Doctrine of conjugated consent: Means combined consent.

choices.text: i, ii, iii, and iv only

questions.text:
Medical negligence by a doctor can be booked under BNS sections:
i. 125
ii. 125a
iii. 125b
iv. 106
v. 304a
questions.solution:
• Sec. 125 BNS → Whoever does any act so rashly or negligently as to endanger human life or the personal safety of others, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months or with fine which may extend to two thousand five hundred rupees, or with both, but-

(a) where hurt is caused, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to six months, or with fine which may extend to five thousand rupees, or with both;

(b) where grievous hurt is caused, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine which may extend to ten thousand rupees, or with both.

  • Sec. 106 BNS → Causing death by negligence - (1) Whoever causes death of any person by doing any rash or negligent act not amounting to culpable homicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine; and if such act is done by a registered medical practitioner while performing medical procedure, he shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

questions.text: A resident doctor used the same needle for two patients while giving antibiotics. Following which the patient became HIV+. This act of gross medical negligence is punishable under:
questions.solution:
• Sec. 270 BNS → Of offences affecting the public health, safety, convenience, decency and morals (Not relevant for us).
  • Sec. 271 BNS → Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life. (The person is not aware of his disease).
  • Sec. 272 BNS → Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life. (The person is aware of his disease).
  • Sec. 273 BNS → Disobedience to quarantine rule.

questions.text: Homicide case comes to doctor. He must inform the police. This comes under:
questions.solution:
• Sec. 33 BNSS → Deals with public to give information of certain offences such as death on operation table during anaesthesia/surgery, homicidal cases etc.
  • Sec. 194 BNSS → Police inquest.
  • Sec. 196 BNSS → Magistrate's inquest.
  • Sec. 51 BNSS → Examination of accused by medical practitioner at request of police officer.

(1) When a person is arrested & brought to the RMP for examination, he can proceed with the examination even without consent at the request of any police officer.

(2) Whenever the person of a female is to be examined under this section, the examination shall be made only by, or under the supervision of a female RMP

questions.text: Injury is defined under which section of BNS?
questions.solution:
• Sec. 2 (14) BNS → Defines 'Injury': 'injury' means any harm whatever illegally caused to any person, in body, mind, reputation or property;
  • Sec 114 BNS → Defines 'Hurt': Whoever causes bodily pain, disease or infirmity to any person is said to cause hurt.
  • Sec. 116 BNS → Grievous hurt
  • Sec. 118 BNS → Voluntarily causing hurt or grievous hurt by dangerous weapons or means (This section defines 'dangerous weapon' also)

questions.text: Any hurt is grievous, provided the victim is unable to follow his ordinary pursuit for a minimum period of
questions.solution:
Sec. 116 BNS → The following kinds of hurt only are designated as 'grievous', namely:--/p>

(a) Emasculation;

(b) Permanent privation of the sight of either eye;

(c) Permanent privation of the hearing of either ear;

(d) Privation of any member or joint;

(e) Destruction or permanent impairing of the powers of any member or joint;

(f) Permanent disfiguration of the head or face;

(g) Fracture or dislocation of a bone or tooth;

(h) Any hurt which endangers life or which causes the sufferer to be during the

space of fifteen days in severe bodily pain, or unable to follow his ordinary pursuits.

questions.text: 'X' shoots 'Y' with an intention to kill, causing wound on the thigh. The bleeding in the thigh stops spontaneously after some time. Under which section of BNS 'X' can be punished?
questions.solution:
Sec. 103 BNS → Punishment for murder

Sec. 105 BNS → Punishment for culpable homicide not amounting to murder

Sec. 110 BNS → Attempt to commit culpable homicide not amounting to murder

Sec. 118 BNS → Voluntarily causing hurt/grievous hurt by dangerous weapons

In this scenario, there is an intention to kill, but the gravity of the injury is not severe.

questions.text: A woman who has been assaulted by her boyfriend in the midnight, comes to the police station to lodge a complaint. There was only one police personnel in the police station and he rapes the woman. In such scenario, that police is punishable under which section of BNS?
questions.solution:
• 63 BNS → Definition of Rape
  • 64 BNS → Punishment for rape.

(1) Whoever, except in the cases provided for in sub-section (2), commits rape, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than ten years, but which may extend to imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

(2) Whoever,-

(a) being a police officer, commits rape,-

(i) within the limits of the police station to which such police officer is appointed; or

(ii) in the premises of any station house; or

(iii) on a woman in such police officer's custody or in the custody of a police officer subordinate to such police officer; or

(b) being a public servant, commits rape on a woman in such public servant's custody or in the custody of a public servant subordinate to such public servant; or

(c) being a member of the armed forces deployed in an area by the Central Government or a State Government commits rape in such area; or

(d) being on the management or on the staff of a jail, remand home or other place of custody established by or under any law for the time being in force or of a women's or children's institution, commits rape on any inmate of such jail, remand home, place or institution; or

(e) being on the management or on the staff of a hospital, commits rape on a woman in that hospital; or

(f) being a relative, guardian or teacher of, or a person in a position of trust or authority towards the woman, commits rape on such woman; or

(g) commits rape during communal or sectarian violence; or

(h) commits rape on a woman knowing her to be pregnant; or

(i) commits rape, on a woman incapable of giving consent; or

(j) being in a position of control or dominance over a woman, commits rape on such woman; or

(k) commits rape on a woman suffering from mental or physical disability; or

(l) while committing rape causes grievous bodily harm or maims or disfigures or endangers the life of a woman; or

(m) commits rape repeatedly on the same woman, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than ten years, but which may extend to imprisonment for life, which shall mean imprisonment for the remainder of that person's natural life, and shall also be liable to fine.

questions.text:
True statement regarding sexual intercourse between husband and wife during separation as per law:
i. Non bailable offence
ii. Only a crime if complained by victim
iii. Defined under Sec. 67 of BNS
iv. Minimum punishment is 2 years
v. Maximum punishment is 5 years
questions.solution:
• Sec. 67 BNS: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation. - Whoever has sexual intercourse with his own wife, who is living separately, whether under a decree of separation or otherwise, without her consent, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than two years but which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.
  • The offense is bailable and cognizable (only on the complaint of the victim).

choices.text: Not punishable, as it is consensual sexual intercourse

questions.text: A final year medical student had attendance shortage as required by the University norms. The Principal asks for the sexual favour in return to allow her to appear for examination. The student agrees for his terms, has sexual intercourse with him and later lodges a police complaint. In such scenario, that Principal is punishable under Section:
questions.solution:
• Sec. 64(2) BNS: Includes custodial rape.
  • Sec. 68 BNS: Sexual intercourse by person in authority - Whoever, being-
    • in a position of authority or in a fiduciary relationship; or
    • a public servant; or
    • superintendent or manager of a jail, remand home or other place of custody established by or under any law for the time being in force, or a women's or children's institution; or
    • on the management of a hospital or being on the staff of a hospital, abuses such position or fiduciary relationship to induce or seduce any woman either in his custody or under his charge or present in the premises to have sexual intercourse with him, such sexual intercourse not amounting to the offence of rape, shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment of either description for a term which shall not be less than five years, but which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
  • Sec. 69 BNS: Sexual intercourse by employing deceitful means, etc. - Whoever, by deceitful means or by making a promise to marry a woman without any intention of fulfilling the same, has sexual intercourse with her, such sexual intercourse not amounting to the offence of rape, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years and shall also be liable to fine.

questions.text: If the doctor and nurse reveal the identity of the rape victim publicly, they are awarded punishment for 2 years under which section?
questions.solution:
• Sec. 72 BNS → Disclosure of identity of victim of certain offences, etc. (1) Whoever prints or publishes the name or any matter which may make known the identity of any person against whom an offence under section 64 or section 65 or section 66 or section 67 or section 68 or section 69 or section 70 or section 71 is alleged or found to have been committed (hereafter in this section referred to as the victim) shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years and shall also be liable to fine.
  • Sec. 397 BNSS → All hospitals, public or private, whether run by the Central Government, the State Government, local bodies or any other person, shall immediately, provide the first-aid or medical treatment, free of cost, to the victims of any offence covered under section 64, section 65, section 66, section 67, section 68, section 70, section 71 or sub-section (1) of section 124 of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, 2023 or under sections 4, 6, 8 or section 10 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012, and shall immediately inform the police of such incident
  • Sec.200 BNS → Whoever, being in charge of a hospital, public or private, whether run by the Central Government, the State Government, local bodies or any other person, contravenes the provisions of section 397 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, 2023, shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.
  • Sec. 366 BNSS → The inquiry into and trial of rape shall be conducted in camera.

questions.text: Embalming without issuing death certificate is punishable under
questions.solution:
• Sec. 238 BNS → Causing disappearance of evidence of offence.
  • Sec. 292 BNS → Whoever commits a public nuisance in any case not otherwise punishable by this Sanhita shall be punished with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees (E.g., Frotteurism).
  • Sec. 296 BNS → Obscene acts and songs: Whoever, to the annoyance of others,- (a) does any obscene act in any public place; or (b) sings, recites or utters any obscene song, ballad or words, in or near any public place, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to one thousand rupees, or with both (E.g., Exhibitionism).
  • Sec. 301 BNS → Trespassing on burial places, etc. - Whoever,with the intention of wounding the feelings of any person, or of insulting the religion of any person or with the knowledge that the feelings of any person are likely to be wounded, or that the religion of any person is likely to be insulted thereby, commits any trespass in any place of worship or on any place of sepulture, or any place set apart for the performance of funeral rites or as a depository for the remains of the dead, or offers any indignity to any human corpse, or causes disturbance to any persons assembled for the performance of funeral ceremonies, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both (E.g., Necrophilia and necrophagia).

questions.text: A group of women forcibly remove the clothes of a 23-year-old INICET exam going male student. The women are punishable under which section of BNS?
questions.solution:
Sec. 74 BNS → Outraging the modesty of a woman → Indecent assault

Sec. 75 BNS → Sexual harassment

Sec. 76 BNS → Disrobe

Sec. 77 BNS → Voyeurism (Scoptophilia)

Sec. 78 BNS → Stalking

Sec. 79 BNS → Insulting the modesty of a woman

Note: Sec. 74 to 79 BNS sections are gender specific (offences against a female). A female cannot be booked under these sections.

questions.text:
A woman commits suicide after 2 years of marriage, leaving behind a suicide note stating that she was harassed by her husband and relatives of her husband in demand of dowry
1. 80 BNS
2. 85 BNS
3. 103 BNS
4. 108 BNS
questions.solution:
• Sec. 80 BNS → Dowry death: (1) Where the death of a woman is caused by any burns or bodily injury or occurs otherwise than under normal circumstances within seven years of her marriage and it is shown that soon before her death she was subjected to cruelty or harassment by her husband or any relative of her husband for, or in connection with, any demand for dowry, such death shall be called 'dowry death', and such husband or relative shall be deemed to have caused her death. (2) Whoever commits dowry death shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which shall not be less than seven years but which may extend to imprisonment for life.
  • Sec. 85 BNS → Husband or relative of husband of a woman subjecting her to cruelty: 'Whoever, being the husband or the relative of the husband of a woman, subjects such woman to cruelty shall be punished with imprisonment for a term which may extend to three years and shall also be liable to fine.
  • Sec. 103 BNS → Punishment for murder.
  • Sec. 108 BNS → Abetment of suicide - If any person commits suicide, whoever abets the commission of such suicide, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.
